snippet: San Bernardino County, with some of the nation’s highest foreclosure rates, may use eminent domain to buy up mortgages and cut them to the current value of the homes.
abstract: San Bernardino County, Calif, with some of the nation’s highest foreclosure rates, may use eminent domain to buy up mortgages and cut them to the current value of the homes; county could hopefully resell the mortgages to a private investment firm, which would allow homeowners to lower their monthly payments and hang onto their property; county is a long way off from putting the policy in place, but idea has rankled banks.
lead_paragraph: San Bernardino County, with some of the nation’s highest foreclosure rates, may use eminent domain to buy up mortgages and cut them to the current value of the homes.

headline.seo: A County Considers Rescue of Underwater Homes
headline.main: California County Weighs Drastic Plan to Aid Homeowners
headline.print_headline: California County Considers a Rescue Plan for Struggling Homeowners
